message: No, I read what exactly what you stated. The point is, a terrorist was able to obtain LEGALLY (he had a background check) his weapons of choice. So, regulations don't work, right? And that is wiping out the bad guys and quit blaming the NRA and other responsible gun owners.

message:
several 5 gallon cans of gasoline would of been more horrific, do we ban gasoline? blaming the gun, """"Isn't this like condemning a robbed man because his possession of money precipitated the evil act of robbery? Isn't this like condemning Socrates because his unswerving commitment to truth and his philosophical
[...Content omitted due to length constraints...]
evil act of crucifixion? We must come to see that, as the federal courts have consistently affirmed, it is wrong to urge an individual to cease his efforts to gain his basic constitutional rights because the quest may precipitate violence. Society must protect the robbed and punish the robber."""" m;lk
